title: misc/cgo: is there a better way to organize it?
body:
by **robert.hencke**: 
It's always felt strange to me that misc/cgo seemed to evolve to serve two purposes: a
set of usage samples, and a suite of tests that are a core part of the build process.

I think of the misc directory as being an assortment of files that are potentially
useful, but not required, for Go development.  I think that's what nags me about
important cgo tests being in there... it felt like it was originally chosen as a
convenient place for the tests because there was already some cgo programs in there, and
then just kind of spiraled to be a mishmash of tests and samples.

I don't have a better idea for where the tests would go, and I'm not trying to bikeshed.
If I am alone in feeling this way, please feel free to close as
wontfix/workingasintended.
